coffeeTypes.name: Espresso
coffeeTypes.description: A concentrated coffee beverage brewed by forcing a small amount of nearly boiling water through finely ground coffee beans.

coffeeTypes.name: Cappuccino
coffeeTypes.description: An espresso-based coffee drink that originated in Italy, and is traditionally prepared with steamed milk foam.

coffeeTypes.name: Americano
coffeeTypes.description: A style of coffee prepared by brewing espresso with added hot water, giving it a similar strength to, but different flavor from, traditionally brewed coffee.

coffeeTypes.name: Latte
coffeeTypes.description: A coffee drink made with espresso and steamed milk.

coffeeTypes.name: Mocha
coffeeTypes.description: A type of coffee made from a combination of espresso, chocolate syrup, and steamed milk.

coffeeTypes.name: Turkish Coffee
coffeeTypes.description: A method of preparing coffee where finely ground coffee beans are simmered in a pot, optionally with sugar, and served in a cup where the grounds are allowed to settle.

coffeeTypes.name: Pike Place Roast
coffeeTypes.description: Starbucks' signature medium-roast coffee with smooth and balanced flavors.

coffeeTypes.name: Caramel Macchiato
coffeeTypes.description: An espresso-based beverage with steamed milk, vanilla syrup, and caramel drizzle.

coffeeTypes.name: Frappuccino
coffeeTypes.description: A blended coffee beverage with ice, milk, and various flavors, topped with whipped cream.

coffeeTypes.name: Flat White
coffeeTypes.description: An espresso-based drink with velvety steamed milk, created with a small layer of microfoam on top.

coffeeTypes.name: Guatemalan Coffee
coffeeTypes.description: Coffee produced in the highlands of Guatemala, known for its full body, rich flavor, and bright acidity.

coffeeTypes.name: Colombian Coffee
coffeeTypes.description: Renowned for its rich and mild flavor, Colombian coffee is grown in the mountainous regions of Colombia.

coffeeTypes.name: Costa Rican Coffee
coffeeTypes.description: Grown in the high-altitude regions of Costa Rica, this coffee is characterized by its bright acidity and fruity notes.

coffeeTypes.name: Mexican Coffee
coffeeTypes.description: Mexican coffee offers a range of flavors, from light and fruity to dark and chocolatey, depending on the region it is grown in.

coffeeTypes.name: Peruvian Coffee
coffeeTypes.description: Peruvian coffee is known for its balanced flavors, medium body, and pleasant acidity.

coffeeTypes.name: Brazilian Coffee
coffeeTypes.description: Brazil is the largest coffee producer in the world, offering a variety of coffee types with different flavors and profiles.

coffeeTypes.name: Ecuadorian Coffee
coffeeTypes.description: Ecuadorian coffee is known for its floral and fruity flavors, often grown in the high-altitude regions of the country.

coffeeTypes.name: Bolivian Coffee
coffeeTypes.description: Bolivian coffee is cultivated in the Yungas region, offering a unique flavor profile with notes of caramel and nuts.

coffeeTypes.name: Nicaraguan Coffee
coffeeTypes.description: Nicaraguan coffee is recognized for its smooth and balanced taste, with flavor notes ranging from chocolate to citrus.

coffeeTypes.name: Honduran Coffee
coffeeTypes.description: Honduran coffee is known for its bright acidity, medium body, and flavor notes of chocolate and nuts.
